payload.description: Middleware for @amphp http-server to handle CORS requests!

release.body:
## What's Changed
* :sparkles: Support for amphp v3 by @Nek- in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/35
* Use constructor property promotion in ConfigurationBuilder::build by @Mateodioev in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/38
* README, CHANGELOG for 1.0 release by @cspray in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/41

## New Contributors
* @Nek- made their first contribution in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/35
* @Mateodioev made their first contribution in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/38

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/compare/0.3.1...1.0.0
release.short_description_html:
What's Changed

  • ✨ Support for amphp v3 by @Nek- in #35
  • Use constructor property promotion in ConfigurationBuilder::build by @Mateodioev in #38
  • README, CHANGELOG for 1.0 release by @cspray in #41

N…

commits.message: README, CHANGELOG for 1.0 release (#41)

issue.title: README needs to be updated
issue.body:
I noticed that the readme mentions that PHP 7 is required for this to work... While the next release will be actually 8.1+.

As saying PHP 7 is compatible is _not wrong_ I didn't edit and suggest a straightforward change. I think adding a table may be a good idea.

But I have no clue about what you want to do about this so here is an issue highlighting the problem :) .

repo.name: http-cors
repo.description: Middleware for @amphp http-server to handle CORS requests!

repo.name: http-cors
repo.description: Middleware for @amphp http-server to handle CORS requests!

issue.title: Update readme with a note about versions

comment.body: Thanks for putting this together! However, I do not plan on supporting versions on PHP 7 and will be releasing a proper 1.0 series. Please see #41. I didn't intend for this to live as a 0.x release as long as it did. I do not expect the API to change at this point. Thanks again for your assistance in getting this kept up to date!

commits.message: initial commit
Improve readme

Merge pull request #1 from enumag/patch-1

Improve readme
Update dependencies
Fix .gitignore
Fix phpunit configuration
Allow amphp/http-server 1.x

Merge pull request #2 from enumag/feature/http-server-2

Update dependencies
Fix CorsMiddleware

Merge pull request #3 from enumag/patch-2

Fix CorsMiddleware
add a composer test script for GH action

Merge pull request #13 from labrador-kennel/task/setup-composer-test-script

add a composer test script for GH action
Setup PHPUnit tests through GH Actions
Run composer test script

Merge pull request #12 from labrador-kennel/github-action-tests

Setup PHPUnit tests through GH Actions

Update ArrayConfiguration to handle missing keys (#15)

It is possible that not all keys would be provided to the
ArrayConfiguration instance because the end developer wanted to use
browser default values. This was particularly true of the `max_age` key.
The ArrayConfiguration instance now handles when optional keys are not
provided and returns reasonable "null values".

If the ArrayConfiguration does not receive AT LEAST an array with keys
`origin` and `allowed_methods` an exception will be thrown because CORS
doesn't make sense without at least this information.

This addresses issue #6
updates changelog with recent releases and new 0.3 functionality merged in (#16)
Remove homebrewed AsyncTestCase for official amphp lib (#17)
Refactor Configuration::getOrigin -> getOrigins (#18)

Add ConfigurationBuilder API (#11)

* Add spike for ConfigurationBuilder API

* implement ConfigurationBuilder. fixes #7

pull_request.title: Bump amphp/http from 2.0.0 to 2.1.1
pull_request.body:
Bumps [amphp/http](https://github.com/amphp/http) from 2.0.0 to 2.1.1.
Release notes

Sourced from amphp/http's releases.

2.1.1

What's Changed

  • Security: Fix Denial of Service via HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Frames by @​kelunik

References

  • https://github.com/amphp/http/security/advisories/GHSA-qjfw-cvjf-f4fm
  • https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Full Changelog: https://github.com/amphp/http/compare/v2.1.0...2.1.1

2.1.0

  • Updated league/uri-components requirements to ^2.4.2 | ^7.1 as part of fixing #24 and allow psr/message@v2
  • Changed request query string encoding to use RFC3986 rules to as part of fixing #24

Full Changelog: https://github.com/amphp/http/compare/v2.0.0...v2.1.0

Commits
  • fe6b4dd Suppress psalm issues
  • 881cc33 Merge pull request from GHSA-qjfw-cvjf-f4fm
  • a19f480 Revert skipping invalid cookies
  • a9bfd3a Skip invalid cookies
  • 9f3500b Test improvements
  • 5640564 Revert to encoding query with RFC3986
  • f6846bc Allow league/uri-components v7
  • cea7aae Use RFC1738 rules to encode and decode query parameters
  • 190e081 Remove leftover .gitmodules
  • fe1d018 Trim single header
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=amphp/http&package-manager=composer&previous-version=2.0.0&new-version=2.1.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/cspray/http-request-builder/network/alerts).

pull_request.title: Bump amphp/http from 1.6.3 to 1.7.3
pull_request.body:
Bumps [amphp/http](https://github.com/amphp/http) from 1.6.3 to 1.7.3.
Release notes

Sourced from amphp/http's releases.

1.7.3

What's Changed

  • Security: Fix Denial of Service via HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Frames by @​kelunik

References

  • https://github.com/amphp/http/security/advisories/GHSA-qjfw-cvjf-f4fm
  • https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Full Changelog: https://github.com/amphp/http/compare/v1.7.2...v1.7.3

1.7.2

What's Changed

  • Make implicit nullable types explicit by @​nicolas-grekas in amphp/http#28

Full Changelog: https://github.com/amphp/http/compare/v1.7.1...v1.7.2

1.7.1

  • Fixed header validation regex to allow names containing *, +, and . (#19)

1.7.0

  • Expose frame and byte count metrics in Http2Parser
  • Reduce strtolower calls, improving performance
  • Relax parsing strictness for request cookies to ignore empty trailing semicolons (amphp/http#18)
Commits
  • 3a33e68 Merge pull request from GHSA-qjfw-cvjf-f4fm
  • 68c61d2 Use older version of php-cs-config
  • 4d21ac9 Make implicit nullable types explicit (#28)
  • 0d729b0 fix validate header with dot (#19)
  • b654546 Extend check to discard empty request cookies (#18)
  • 2437d31 Add check to discard empty request cookies (#18)
  • 9e429aa Reduce strtolower calls
  • 5006170 Move ini values to setup step
  • 5043560 Fix passing flags to PHP instead of phpunit
  • 3ec9cf7 Enable exceptions for assertions
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=amphp/http&package-manager=composer&previous-version=1.6.3&new-version=1.7.3)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. issue.title: Drop support for amphp/http-server 1.x
issue.body: This library does not aim to provide backwards compatibility for all amp versions. We aim to support the latest major release. The reasoning for this is simple: I do not have the time to allow for maintenance of many major versions across all of the labrador kennel repos and it is easier to consistently support the latest releases instead of having different rules for each repo.

comment.body: This was handled in #35 and will be released with the 1.0 tag.

issue.title: Drop support for amphp/http-server 1.x
issue.body: This library does not aim to provide backwards compatibility for all amp versions. We aim to support the latest major release. The reasoning for this is simple: I do not have the time to allow for maintenance of many major versions across all of the labrador kennel repos and it is easier to consistently support the latest releases instead of having different rules for each repo.

issue.title: Update docs to reflect latest changes
issue.body:
- [ ] Update to latest labrador-kennel.github.io to ensure new syntax highlighting is used
- [ ] Move examples in gists to in-documentation to reduce burden on reading docs in-repo.
